sentences.en: And that was the vicious and voluble end of the seven young parrots.

sentences.en: Bert is a voluble, gregarious man.

sentences.en: Clarissa was extremely voluble on the subject of good manners.

sentences.en: He became very voluble and told her everything.

sentences.en: He carried the others off their feet, glib, dexterous, voluble.

sentences.en: He has been voluble to the point of suffocation, then quiet as the Jordan.
sentences.cn: 他滔滔不绝直到把自个儿憋得透不过气来, 随后又像约旦河一样沉默无语.

sentences.en: In such a voluble way, Collins unfolds his Beijing life to me.

sentences.en: Pompiou replaced the voluble Foreign Minister Maurice Schumann.

sentences.en: Self - esteem is the most voluble of the emotions.

sentences.en: The new comer in our company is voluble.

words.tran_cn: 健谈的；缠绕的；易旋转的

trans.tran_cn: 喋喋不休的，爱说话的，（指说话）快的，口若悬河的
trans.tran_en: If you say that someone is voluble, you mean that they talk a lot with great energy and enthusiasm
